scenarios.scenarioHeading: Invoke PI API using the test data in excel file

items.stepText: And the user saves test data inside excel file into data stores

messages: "osanda12" is successfully saved as a text in Scenario Data Store [username]
"Password1" is successfully saved as a text in Specification Data Store [password]

items.stepText: Given that a user needs to invoke "Get Staging PI Token"

messages:
API Endpoint is: 
https://int-piapi-internal.stg-openclass.com/tokens

HTTP Method is: POST

items.stepText: And the user set the request authentication configurations as follows

cells: Do you need to retrieve the access token from the text file?
Provide the access token if you need to authorize the API manually

items.stepText: And the user set the request attributes using data stores as follows

messages:
Text inside Scenario Data Store [username] is: "osanda12"

Text inside Specification Data Store [password] is: "Password1"

The JSON request body that you are going to use for the API is:
{
 "userName": "osanda12",
 "password": "Password1"
}

items.stepText: When the user invokes the API

messages:

Invoked API Endpoint: 
https://int-piapi-internal.stg-openclass.com/tokens

HTTP Method is: POST

items.stepText: Then the status code for the request is "201"
And the JSON Path Assertions for the response should be equal to the following
And save the access token in the response which is located inside the JSON Path of "$.data"

messages: Successfully saved the access token into the text file in the directory of "C:\Users\Osanda Deshan\IdeaProjects\MaxSoft-IntelliAPI\resources/access_tokens/saved_valid_access_token.txt"
